definition: survival/the struggle to eke out a living/to seek for continued existence
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: Than why do the lovers work so hard to stay alive?
sentences.chinese: 那为何情人们却为了求存而活得如此辛苦？

sentences.english: The pumpkin vines struggle to survive.

definition: to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to seek survival/to possess the will to live
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
see 苟且偷安[gou3 qie3 tou1 an1]
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
